com.github.vfro

Class Monitor<Value>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.vfro.Monitor<Value>
  • Type Parameters:
    Value - value of the monitor.

    public class Monitor<Value>
extends Object
    Monitor can be used for concurrent access to a value. It also provides an ability to wait until the value becomes into some certain state. 
     Monitor<Queue<String>> outputQueue =
    new Monitor<<String>>(new LinkedList<String>());

 // ...
 while(true) {
    // Wait until some string is added to a queue
    // and printit into System.out
    outputQueue.writeAccess(
       queue -> {
             System.out.println(queue.pull());

             // Write access lambda must return the parameter object
             // to preserve reference to the queue
             return queue;
          },
       queue -> !queue.isEmpty()
    );
 }

 // Some other thread
 outputQueue.writeAccess(
    queue -> {
          queue.add("Hello Monitor!");
          return queue;
       }
 );

    • Constructor Detail

      • Monitor

        public Monitor(Value value)
        Create new instance of Monitor initialized by specified value.
        Parameters:
        value - initial value of the monitor.

      • Monitor

        protected Monitor(Value value,
                  Lock readLock,
                  Lock writeLock)
        Create new instance of Monitor initialized by value and custom locks. Custom locks must be re-entrant and support lock downgrading (Acquiring read lock inside write lock, and release write lock after that).
        Parameters:
        value - initial value of a monitor.
        readLock - Custom read lock.
        writeLock - Custom write lock. It may be the same instance as readLock.

    • Method Detail

      • getValue

        protected Value getValue()
        Get access to monitored value without any synchronization.
        Returns:
        the monitored value.

      • setValue

        protected void setValue(Value value)
        Modify monitored value directly without any synchronization.
        Parameters:
        value - the new monitored value.

      • getReadLock

        protected final Lock getReadLock()
        Get a lock which is used for read access.
        Returns:
        read access lock.

      • getWriteLock

        protected final Lock getWriteLock()
        Get lock which is used for write access.
        Returns:
        write access lock.

      • getCondition

        protected final Condition getCondition()
        Get a condition variable which is signaled after state of the monitored value becomes changed.
        Returns:
        condition variable.

      • readAccess

        public final void readAccess(Consumer<Value> consumer)
        Access monitored value for read (in shared mode).
        Parameters:
        consumer - to obtain read access. The consumer must not change internal state of monitored value.

      • readAccess

        public final void readAccess(Consumer<Value> consumer,
                             Predicate<Value> predicate)
                      throws InterruptedException
        Causes current thread to wait until monitor becomes to some certain state and access monitored value for read (in shared mode). Predicate expression must not change a state of monitored value.
        Parameters:
        consumer - to obtain read access. Consumer must not change internal state of monitored value.
        predicate - to define a state of monitored value.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if the current thread is interrupted.

      • readAccess

        public final boolean readAccess(Consumer<Value> consumer,
                                Predicate<Value> predicate,
                                long time,
                                TimeUnit unit)
                         throws InterruptedException
        Causes current thread to wait until monitor becomes to some certain state and access monitored value for read (in shared mode). Predicate instance must not change a state of monitored value.
        Parameters:
        consumer - to obtain read access. The instance must not change internal state of monitored value.
        predicate - to define a state of monitored value.
        time - the maximum time to wait.
        unit - the time unit of the time argument.
        Returns:
        true if the monitored value has been accessed or false if the waiting time detectably elapsed before return from the method.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if the current thread is interrupted.

      • writeAccess

        public final void writeAccess(Function<Value,Value> function)
        Access monitored value for write (in exclusive mode). Return value of function becomes new value of monitor.
        Parameters:
        function - instance change monitored value. The function may change internal state of monitored value.

      • writeAccess

        public final void writeAccess(Function<Value,Value> function,
                              Predicate<Value> predicate)
                       throws InterruptedException
        Causes current thread to wait until monitor becomes to some certain state and access monitored value for write (in exclusive mode). Return value of function becomes new value of monitor.
        Parameters:
        function - to obtain write access. The function may change internal state of monitored value.
        predicate - to define a state of monitored value.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if the current thread is interrupted.

      • writeAccess

        public final boolean writeAccess(Function<Value,Value> function,
                                 Predicate<Value> predicate,
                                 long time,
                                 TimeUnit unit)
                          throws InterruptedException
        Causes current thread to wait until monitor becomes to some certain state and access monitored value for write (in exclusive mode). Return value of function becomes new value of monitor.
        Parameters:
        function - to obtain write access. The function may change internal state of monitored value.
        predicate - to define a state of monitored value.
        time - the maximum time to wait.
        unit - the time unit of the time argument.
        Returns:
        true if the monitored value has been accessed or false if the waiting time detectably elapsed before return from the method.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if the current thread is interrupted.

        public final Value set(Value value)
